meanings.definition: A person who cheats or swindles others.
meanings.sent1: The gypper tricked the old man into giving him all his money.
meanings.sent2: Be careful, that gypper is known for deceiving people with fake promises.
meanings.sent3: The gypper tried to sell a broken watch as brand new, but no one fell for it.
meanings.sent4: She was a master gypper, always finding ways to manipulate others for her own gain.
meanings.sent5: The town was wary of the gypper who had a reputation for dishonesty.

meanings.sent1: He tried to gypper his way out of paying for the meal by pretending to forget his wallet.
meanings.sent2: She felt guilty after gyppering her friend in the card game.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to gypper the dog's bone, but got caught in the act.
meanings.sent4: The con artist gyppered unsuspecting tourists by selling them fake souvenirs.
meanings.sent5: The student attempted to gypper the teacher by copying answers during the test.

meanings.sent1: The gypper's scheme to sell counterfeit goods was soon uncovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: His gypper of a plan to get rich quick backfired when people realized the truth.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed a hilarious gypper trying to outsmart everyone in town.
meanings.sent4: The movie depicted a thrilling gypper involving a high-stakes heist.
meanings.sent5: The book described a cunning gypper who always managed to stay one step ahead of the law.
